d'holbach.gloss: French philosopher (born in Germany) famous as being one of the first self-described atheists in Europe

d. h. lawrence.gloss: English novelist and poet and essayist whose work condemned industrial society and explored sexual relationships (1885-1930)

dhak.gloss: East Indian tree bearing a profusion of intense vermilion velvet-textured blooms and yielding a yellow dye

dhaka.gloss: the capital and largest city of Bangladesh

dhal.gloss: tropical woody herb with showy yellow flowers and flat pods

dhava.gloss: an Indian tree of the family Combretaceae that is a source of timber and gum

dhodhekanisos.gloss: a group of islands in the southeast Aegean Sea

dhole.gloss: fierce wild dog of the forests of central and southeast Asia that hunts in packs
